newsArray.title: Slot Can Be Perfect Replacement For Klopp –Van Basten
creator: Austin Akhilomen
newsArray.description: Netherlands legend Marco van Basten believes Feyenoord manager, Arne Slot has the capability take over from Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool manager. Recall that the Reds were thought to be close to appointing Ruben Amorim earlier this month. However, they have now turned to Feyenoord boss Slot, with Amorim linked to West Ham United. Read Also: President Federation Cup: Round of 64 Games To Hold Next Week "I think he's really good," Van Basten stated on Ziggo Sport's 'Rondo.' "I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it is an enrichment for Dutch football. "He can really go anywhere – Bayern Munich, Liverpool… I'm really convinced of that. I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong. He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent. I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent. He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level. He first did it at AZ, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club. "He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money. He could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football. "You can clearly see his hand where he is the coach. I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. I also think he is smart enough to manage stubborn players." The post Slot Can Be Perfect Replacement For Klopp –Van Basten appeared first on Complete Sports.

newsArray.title: The Knowledge | Can any footballer top Kingsley Coman’s run of consecutive league titles?
creator: Guardian sport
newsArray.description: Plus: players injured warming up on touchline, points-per-game differentials of long-serving players and moreMail us your questions or tweet @TheKnowledge_GU“Leverkusen’s Bundesliga title win has broken Kingsley Coman’s remarkable run of winning the league in each of the last 11 seasons (with PSG, Juventus and Bayern). Can any player in world football ever boast of a longer run of consecutive league titles?” asks Richard Forsythe.“It’s worth bearing in mind that Coman technically won 12 league titles in 11 seasons,” writes Sean DeLoughry, who gets the ball rolling as we spin off from this 2022 question and answer. “He played once for Juventus in Serie A at the start of the 2015-16 season before joining Bayern. Continue reading...
